meanings.definition: To dress or clothe inappropriately or unsuitably.
meanings.sent1: She was missuiting for the formal event by wearing jeans and a t-shirt.
meanings.sent2: The job interview went well until he started missuiting in his casual attire.
meanings.sent3: The penguin was missuiting in a Hawaiian shirt at the black-tie gala.
meanings.sent4: His loud tie was missuiting with his otherwise elegant suit.
meanings.sent5: The superhero was caught missuiting in his costume at the corporate meeting.

meanings.definition: Not matching or fitting well together.
meanings.sent1: The missuiting colors of the room clashed horribly.
meanings.sent2: The puzzle pieces were missuiting and didn't connect properly.
meanings.sent3: The mismatched socks were missuiting but oddly charming.
meanings.sent4: Her words and actions were missuiting, causing confusion among the audience.
meanings.sent5: The jigsaw puzzle was a mess with its missuiting pieces scattered everywhere.
